page.title: 09The Mumbles Train
page.content: The Mumbles biggest claim to fame is that the first passenger carrying railway in the world (1807-1960) ran from Swansea to Mumbles.Initially laid for the movement of limestone,iron ore and coal from local quarries etc. to industrial Swansea. It will be best remembered for the side to side rocking motion of the cars as they ran the five mile journey along the most beautifully curved bay in the country,beginning with horse-drawn tram-cars,the railway tried sail,accumulator,petrol,diesel and finally electric cars capable of carrying 107 seated passengers.The memory of the line is kept alive with a working model in OO guage made and exhibited by the Oystermouth Model Railway Club,and by the Mumbles Railway Society who are striving to have the line reinstated.
